imdb.title: Akame ga Kill!
imdb.plot: A countryside boy named Tatsumi sets out on a journey to The Capital to make a name for himself and met a seemingly dangerous group of Assassins known as Night Raid. Their journey begins.

episodes.title: Kill the Darkness
episodes.plot: Tatsumi and his friends seek to find their fortunes in the Imperial Capital to help their fledgling village. After being swindled by a beautiful woman, a generous stranger offers him a place to stay the night, nothing but misfortune follows.

episodes.title: Kill the Authority
episodes.plot: After witnessing the horrors of the capital Tatsumi decides to join Night Raid to eradicate the corruption in the capital. Akame begins to train him for his first contract.

episodes.title: Kill Your Cares
episodes.plot: Mine is next up on Tatsumi's training sessions partners, and her taciturn nature makes things difficult to say the least. Meanwhile, a new assignment comes up, and Mine and Tatsumi are to carry out an assassination.

episodes.title: Kill the Imperial Arm Users
episodes.plot: Tatsumi learns about the history of the Imperial Arms, and wants one of his own. Night Raid's latest target is also revealed: Zank the Executioner, who's hobbies include cutting off people's heads.

episodes.title: Kill the Dream
episodes.plot: Sheele takes Tatsumi under her wing as the next lesson begins, and he is even given Zank's old Imperial Arms to test for compatibility. After running from loan collections with Leone, Tatsumi meets a strange Imperial officer.

episodes.title: Kill the Absolute Justice
episodes.plot: Tatsume and Leone are sent on a mission meanwhile Sheele and Mine get caught in a fight with an imperial arms.

episodes.title: Kill the Three: Part 1
episodes.plot: General Esdeath returns victorious from the North, and pledges to defend the Capital against any enemies. Mourning Shelre's death, Tatsumi and the rest of Night Raid start planning how to defeat the Capital's defenders.

episodes.title: Kill the Three: Part 2
episodes.plot: Continuing their mission, Tatsumi and Bulat must face Esdeath's Relic-wielding servants, even to if this could mean they could be killed by these powerful opponents.

episodes.title: Kill the Battle Fanatic
episodes.plot: General Esdeath assembles a new team of Relic-wielders to fight besides her. Tatsumi, Leone and Lubboth go to the Capital to ear some money in a mysterious fighting tournament, without knowing what it's true purpose is.

episodes.title: Kill the Temptation
episodes.plot: Tatsumi, captured by Esdeath, struggles with her romantic feelings towards her. They witness the power of the newly assembled Jaegers during a mission, and Tatsumi fears that this new enemy is becoming very strong.

episodes.title: Kill the Mad Scientist
episodes.plot: Lord Stylish has caught the members of Night Raid unaware in the dead of night. As his makeshift experiments run amok within Night Raid HQ, more Imperial Arms users appear, and one is holding on to a familiar pair of scissors...

episodes.title: Kill the Newcomers
episodes.plot: Susanoo and Chelsea, the newest members of Night Raid. Najenda introduces each new fighter and their set of skills to the group. As everyone gets acclimated to the new company, a new danger lurks beneath the earth.

episodes.title: Kill the Nuisances
episodes.plot: A new type of Danger Beast has emerged, roaming the countryside while killing and eating everything in sight. While the Jaegers hunt them down, Night Raid decides that for once, they will help out the Capital.

episodes.title: Kill the Giant Danger Beast
episodes.plot: Esdeath and Tatsumi get teleported to a deserted island by an Imperial Arms user who can control space and time. While trying to find a way off the island, Esdeath reveals her past to Tatsumi.

episodes.title: Kill the Religious Organization
episodes.plot: Najenda announces that now is the time to strike the Capital with all their might. The group splits in two to draw The Jaegers out of the city, hoping to leave their real target defenseless within its walls.

episodes.title: Kill the Puppets
episodes.plot: Night Raid engages Bols and Kurome, along with her puppets.

episodes.title: Kill the Curse
episodes.plot: Chelsea goes on the hunt to finish of Kurome for good. Akame reminisces about her sister and how they got to this point in their lives.

episodes.title: Kill the Demon
episodes.plot: The Jeagers meet up with Night Raid's target and get introduced to the Four Rakshasa Demons, personal protectors of the Minister. While Mine and Tatsumi survey the perimeter, Lubbock is caught off guard by Sten and Mez, two of the four demons.

episodes.title: Kill the Fate
episodes.plot: The assault on the Capital continues, and while Mine and Tatsumi have their fair share with Seryu and the last Rakshasa demon, Najenda and the rest hunt down their target.

episodes.title: Kill the Carnage
episodes.plot: Bloodless surrenders infuriate the Minister, even as he introduces his son Shura as the leader of a new group of elites. While Lubbock and Tatsumi lurk the streets looking for weaknesses, Mine and Leone roam the tunnels doing the same.

episodes.title: Kill the Despair
episodes.plot: The remaining members of Night Raid launch an emergency mission to rescue Tatsumi. Esdeath gives Tatsumi a choice: join her, or die by her hand.

episodes.title: Kill the Little Sister
episodes.plot: Akame receives a hidden message to meet at a place of significance from her past. Upon arriving it turns out that her sister, Kurome, sent the message. They reminiscence on their history together before beginning a final fight.

episodes.title: Kill the Emperor
episodes.plot: With the Empire all but finished, the child emperor unleashes the ultimate Imperial Arms. With a new and devastating weapon at hand, the Minister continues his marionette act, guiding the city toward destruction as Night Raid attacks.

episodes.title: Akame ga Kill!
episodes.plot: The Empire is defeated, yet Esdeath refuses to surrender. Najenda unleashes Akame, commanding her to annihilate Esdeath. They battle and we finally see Akame's Trump Card. As the battle ends the Prime Minister tries to escape.
